title: Full stack for SDE roles ???
content: I'm a 6th sem , ECE student and i wanted to know if full stack dev is mandatory for SDE roles in the placements . I haven't done web dev and neither am i too interested in them . I'm more focused on data science and ML and wanted to know if not knowing web dev would be a drawback

comments.body:
Completing the course is mandatory.

Learning web dev is optional

It depends but most cases they don't care. Sometimes not having web dev projects can be detrimental if the job role is of web dev(happened with me).

I suggest just learn the basics and some two or three good full stack projects you still have time just make sure the projects are not that simple clones easily available on net.


>I'm more focused on data science and ML

It's good but don't be particular on this. There are hardly any entry level roles in data science and ML for bachelors students.

Even those that say ML engineer and Data scientist on JD will have you working on SQL  ,Pandas and Tableau. Instead of the core DS or ML.

If you are really serious about ML and DS get a masters from good university abroad or T-1 uni in India
